results.justification: The document explicitly states the methodology, focusing on experimental studies investigating the effects of explanations on algorithm aversion. (e.g., 'In this paper, we provide a background on algorithm aversion in education and present two experimental studies…')

Both Study 1 and Study 2 have detailed descriptions of their design, participants, procedure, manipulation, and measures. (e.g., 'Study 1 employed a two (explanation) by two (visualization) between-subjects design…', '4.2 Experimental Manipulation')

The document states: 'All code, data, and supplementary materials for this study are available on OSF https://osf.io/cjadu.' and 'Materials on OSF https://osf.io/7c5zt/?view_only=58f0a6314e9243e9acdbd1c844d43d7b'
The document describes the measures used, including scales and adaptations from prior work. (e.g., 'We measured participants’ attitudes towards each algorithm using six questions…')

Data collection methods are fully described, including recruitment through Prolific, survey administration, and the use of specific scales. (e.g., 'We recruited 170 participants from Prolific…', '3.4 Measures')
The document states: 'All code, data, and supplementary materials for this study are available on OSF https://osf.io/cjadu.'
The document states: 'All code, data, and supplementary materials for this study are available on OSF https://osf.io/cjadu.' implying that scripts for data cleaning and analysis are included.

Statistical tests (linear regression), effect sizes, and p-values are reported throughout the results sections. (e.g., 'We examined how algorithm preference varies across experimental conditions by fitting a linear regression model…', '𝑏 = 0.466,𝑡164 = 2.583,𝑝 = 0.011')

The document includes a thematic analysis of open-ended responses from participants, providing subjective context and interpretation. (e.g., 'We extracted two types of themes from this analysis…', 'Table 3: Descriptions of the themes about algorithm details in the note.')
The document states: 'The study was preregistered on OSF at https://osf.io/cjadu.'

The document clearly presents the results of both studies, including statistical findings and interpretations. (e.g., 'Contrary to our hypothesis (H3), participants in the 3RR condition rated the tool lower in perceived competence and trust…')

The document discusses limitations, such as the use of Prolific participants and the context of ITS, and potential biases. (e.g., 'First, the data collected was from educators on Prolific…', 'Although we were limited by the constraints of a 10-minute online experimental study…')
